🏆 Vestas' Cable-Stayed Rotor (CSR) technology just clinched the gold for Best Innovation at @windpower_m's Turbines of the Year Awards!

This achievement highlights our dedication to being a trailblazer in renewable energy technology.

Read more: https://t.co/ISI2DaQOTJ https://t.co/uoJBCZNLfa

🏆 V163-4.5MW™ claims the top spot in @windpower_m’s annual "Turbines of the Year" Awards.

This recognition underscores the commercial significance of our latest #HighCapacityFactor wind turbine which has been awarded Gold in the category of Onshore Turbines up to 5.6 MW. https://t.co/KZnljS4ipt

@corporateknight This is another example of our commitment to sustainability in everything we do even as we push forward on the energy transition. 
#CKG100
@corporateknight By improving our sustainability performance, we pave the way for the renewable energy industry to expand without compromising the interests of future generations.

@corporateknight Congratulations also to our fellow Danish companies ranked among the Top 100 this year: #8 Chr Hansen Holding A/S, #17 Ørsted A/S, #53 Novo Nordisk A/S, #58 Novozymes A/S and #78 Coloplast A/S!

As part of the most recent @corporateknight's Global 100 ranking, we’ve been named the most sustainable company in the entire energy industry in 2024 and remain in the top three across all sectors in the world.
We’ve been ranked the most sustainable company in the entire energy industry, for the 3rd year in a row! https://t.co/ucaXaWp0qu

RT @KadriSimson: The @EU_Commission presented the #WindPowerActionPlan last October, to support & accelerate the EU wind industry🌬️⚡️

✅I m…

Check out our press release:
@ORLEN_Group @northlandpower @ArcelorMittal  https://t.co/O8gC2zOYrJ

and a 52% reduction for onshore towers. 
 
The first project to use low-emission steel is #BalticPower’s offshore wind farm in Poland. The 1.2 GW project consisting of 76 V236-15.0 MW offshore wind turbines is set to have the top section of 52 towers made with low-emission steel. https://t.co/XFjrnHmafh

A substantial reduction of 66% in emission intensity per kg steel compared to the conventional steelmaking route.
By incorporating low-emission steel in offshore wind turbine towers, we anticipate a 25% reduction in emissions compared to conventional steel

The low-emission steel is produced using 100% steel scrap, melted in an electric arc furnace powered by 100% wind energy at ArcelorMittal's steel mill Industeel Charleroi in Belgium. The result? https://t.co/FVFUHhRy7X

In another big step towards a more sustainable future, we have partnered with @ArcelorMittal to launch a low-emission steel offering that is significantly reducing carbon emissions in wind turbine tower production. https://t.co/S3WBxqLDaQ

🇪🇺 has achieved a solid 17 GW in new wind energy for 2023. However, with agreed 2030 targets set at 420 GW, we must accelerate to a point where we have a build out of 30 GW annually until 2030 to meet our green goals. Let’s double down on implementation!
https://t.co/wsF5e49pga https://t.co/Rq1LxguPDy

🌎 / 🇵🇱: Advancing on #offshorewind with a second factory in Poland.  We plan to establish a new blade factory in Szczecin, Poland to produce blades for our flagship offshore wind turbine, the V236-15.0 MW.
Read more: https://t.co/A8PrK8bzoM https://t.co/5IXRpmZgRV

We're kicking 2024 off with an all-time high in quarterly announced orders!

◾ 30 order announcements across Asia, Australia, Europe, Africa and North America

#ACPOffshore23 starts today.

The  race for bigger turbines in the #windindustry is cause for concern. Introducing a new turbine platform requires rethinking of the entire value chain. From new tools to new vessels that are so large, that they potentially don’t fit into existing harbours. (1/4) https://t.co/6IrRDNT7vl

🇺🇸 We were thrilled to host @RepBonamici at our technician training center in Portland. The wind industry is a real opportunity to bring new, clean energy jobs to local communities. We applaud the Congresswoman for supporting #renewableenergy & championing workforce development. https://t.co/ksmWUoX3uS

@USCleanPower With 24,000 of our turbines operating across the 🇺🇸, we are proud to contribute to a cleaner future and healthier communities.
#Offshorewind is set to accelerate the #energytransition and we are thrilled to play a key role in growing the U.S. offshore wind industry.

Each year, wind and solar power avoid emitting 426 million metric tons of carbon dioxide in the 🇺🇸, according to @USCleanPower. 
That’s the equivalent to taking 93 million gas-powered cars off the road each year! https://t.co/VgydAnS2Ea

From frozen tundras to tropical seas to deep waters, we know what it takes to deploy and operate #offshorewind. We’re bringing our +25 years of unrivalled offshore wind experience and unmatched track record to the emerging 🇺🇸 market. https://t.co/jlELthjqzV

Across the 🇺🇸, we have over 17,000 onshore turbines under service – almost 40 GW! 
With more experience than anyone else in the industry, we’re proud to bring this expertise now to the U.S. #offshore industry. Let’s ensure safe and reliable turbine operations! https://t.co/diIvVE0bxI

Just as the 🇺🇸 East Coast is weather resilient, so too is our V236-15 MW! 
Did you know it’s designed to withstand extreme wind conditions up to 57 m/s (127 mph)➡️https://t.co/IOQ3ivvF0a https://t.co/h4gO1Vo6yj

Achieving profitability this year is the first step for us in this journey, and we send a huge thanks to our customers, partners and the 29 000 employees whose relentless effort is making this goal possible in 2023.”

Commenting on the results, our CEO Henrik Andersen says: “In order to deliver the energy transition, we must improve industry maturity. For Vestas, this means focusing more than ever on commercial and operational discipline, quality, and scalability across our value chain.
Our underlying performance continues to improve driven by significant growth in our Service business and the increasing value of our turbine deliveries.

Financial report for the Q2 of 2023.

With a 4% increase in revenue compared to the same period last year and an EBIT margin of -2%, we are on track with our financial outlook. 
(1/5)🧵 https://t.co/whBbO43wJc

Did you know that we were the first to install 100 GW of #windenergy? Experience, technology, and ambition are key to accelerate #offshore wind in the U.S. We look forward to bringing all of this to build the industry: https://t.co/IOQ3ivvF0a https://t.co/2ijxYHX1rB

We have been on the forefront of building a domestic supply chain to support our onshore business, spending $1.6 billion across 1,200 U.S. suppliers last year alone. We look forward to working with our partners to support a similar build out for the U.S. #offshorewind industry. https://t.co/JZX0NK8puu

Did you know that our turbines power 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿’s largest offshore wind farm: Seagreen? The project is expected to generate enough clean energy to power two-thirds of all Scottish homes. We look forward to leveraging this experience to bring the first 🇺🇸 #offshore projects to operation. https://t.co/BnBBa2uXhJ
